title: Rustc doesn't provide suggestions on typo'd trait functions

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
Given the [following code on nightly](https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=nightly&mode=debug&edition=2018&gist=1548de264ca82da0deb797b83ea916c5): 

```rust
trait Foo {
    fn baz(&self) { }
}

struct Bar;

impl Foo for Bar {}

fn main() {
    Bar.bar()
}
```

The current output is:

```
error[E0599]: no method named `bar` found for struct `Bar` in the current scope
  --> src/main.rs:10:9
   |
5  | struct Bar;
   | ----------- method `bar` not found for this
...
10 |     Bar.bar()
   |         ^^^ method not found in `Bar`

For more information about this error, try `rustc --explain E0599`.
error: could not compile `playground` due to previous error
```

Ideally the output should look like:

```
error[E0599]: no method named `bar` found for struct `Bar` in the current scope
  --> src/main.rs:14:9
   |
5  | struct Bar;
   | ----------- method `bar` not found for this
...
14 |     Bar.bar()
   |         ^^^ help: there is an associated trait function with a similar name: `baz`

For more information about this error, try `rustc --explain E0599`.
error: could not compile `playground` due to previous error
```

As a slightly less trivial example, I had something like this ([nightly playground](https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=nightly&mode=debug&edition=2018&gist=15f68a6f387dcfaba708795255fd0160)):

```rust
use futures::{stream, StreamExt};

fn main() {
    stream::iter(0..100).buffered_unordered(10);
}
```

And got a very not-helpful error message, which led me down to debugging an entirely different rabbit hole (maybe some other expression's type wasn't correctly infer; maybe there's a trait bound restriction), rather than a simple typo. 

cc: @davidbarsky
